title: Wayne Rooney's son Kai 'to be given chance to rejoin Manchester City's academy'
text:
Manchester City will offer Wayne Rooney's oldest son Kai a chance to rejoin their academy now that the family have returned to England.

City snapped up Kai when he was six years old in 2016, whilst Wayne was still captain at rivals Manchester United.

It is believed City told the youngster when Rooney moved to DC from Everton in 2018 that they would look to take him back into their development fold once the family returned to England, according to The Mirror.

Manchester City will offer Wayne Rooney's son Kai (left) a chance to rejoin their academy

The United and England legend spent 18 months at DC United but is now returning to England where he will join Derby County as a player-coach.

Kai, who is highly rated by City, continued to play football overseas whilst the family lived in America.

The striker's time in America has now come to an end after his DC United side were thumped 5-1 in the MLS play-offs.

Rooney has signed for the Rams on an initial 18-month contract until the summer of 2021, with the option of a further year.

The deal will see Rooney become the highest earning player in the Championship after agreeing a £100,000 a week deal, funded in part by a record sponsorship deal with betting company 32Red.
